title: Info Lookup — Number & Vehicle Registration Lookup (Dark Hacker Theme)

requirements.summary: Build a single-page UI with two distinct lookup tools (Number Info and Vehicle Info), each with input, action, and results area.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI clearly offers two distinct lookup sections (tabs or segmented panels): “Number Info” and “Vehicle Info”.
Both sections are accessible without authentication.
Each section has an input field, a primary action button to run the lookup, and an area to display results.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page app shell and render two lookup sections using shadcn-ui (e.g., Tabs for switching and Card for panels). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Number Info lookup section UI: input, primary action button, and results display region; designed to be embedded in the tabs/panels. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Vehicle Registration Info lookup section UI: input, primary action button, and results display region; designed to be embedded in the tabs/panels. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable result viewer to render readable responses (pretty-printed JSON and/or key/value layout) and show empty-state messaging in English. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement Number Info lookup via HTTP request to the provided URL with num= query parameter, including loading and error states.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user enters a value and runs the lookup, the app performs an HTTP request to `https://usesirosint.vercel.app/api/numinfo?key=salaarz&num=<USER_INPUT>`.
A loading state is shown while the request is in progress.
On success, the response is rendered in a readable format (pretty-printed JSON or a key/value table).
On failure (network error or non-2xx), a clear English error message is shown and the UI remains usable.

file_operations.description: Implement the React Query hook for Number Info lookup, performing a fetch to `https://usesirosint.vercel.app/api/numinfo?key=salaarz&num=` + encoded user input, and surfacing loading/success/error states.

Wire the Number Info UI to use the React Query hook, show an in-progress loading state, render success results via ResultViewer, and show a clear English error message on failure. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement Vehicle Registration Info lookup via HTTP request to the provided URL with reg= query parameter, including loading and error states.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user enters a value and runs the lookup, the app performs an HTTP request to `https://vehicle-number-info.snipy-owner.workers.dev/?reg=<USER_INPUT>`.
A loading state is shown while the request is in progress.
On success, the response is rendered in a readable format (pretty-printed JSON or a key/value table).
On failure (network error or non-2xx), a clear English error message is shown and the UI remains usable.

file_operations.description: Implement the React Query hook for Vehicle Registration Info lookup, performing a fetch to `https://vehicle-number-info.snipy-owner.workers.dev/?reg=` + encoded user input, and surfacing loading/success/error states.

Wire the Vehicle Info UI to use the React Query hook, show an in-progress loading state, render success results via ResultViewer, and show a clear English error message on failure. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a responsive, desktop-friendly layout that uses wide centered container and/or multi-column arrangement on desktop and stacks on mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop widths, the layout uses a wider centered container and/or multi-column arrangement to avoid overly stretched text.
On mobile widths, the layout stacks content vertically with comfortable spacing and touch-friendly controls.
No horizontal scrolling is required on common viewport sizes.

file_operations.description: Implement a responsive page structure with a centered container and a desktop-friendly arrangement (e.g., two-column layout for input/results within a panel at larger breakpoints) while stacking vertically on mobile. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust the Number Info panel layout for desktop (input/action and results can use columns) and mobile (stacked) with touch-friendly controls. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust the Vehicle Info panel layout for desktop (input/action and results can use columns) and mobile (stacked) with touch-friendly controls. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent dark hacker/terminal theme with high-contrast English UI text across both lookup sections.
acceptanceCriteria: The default appearance is a dark theme with high contrast and a coherent, terminal/cyber-inspired visual style.
All labels, buttons, placeholders, errors, and headings are in English.
The theme is applied consistently across both lookup sections (typography, spacing, colors, components).

file_operations.description: Create global styling for a dark hacker theme (dark background, high-contrast foreground, terminal-green accents) and ensure the app defaults to dark mode via the document/body styling.

Ensure headings, labels, placeholders, and button text are English and consistent with the hacker/terminal theme; apply consistent typography and spacing across both tools. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure result rendering uses readable monospace/terminal-inspired formatting and English empty/error helper text consistent with the theme. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Use React Query for both lookups with caching keyed by the user input to avoid unnecessary refetching.
acceptanceCriteria: Each lookup uses React Query (or equivalent project-standard query abstraction) with a query key that includes the user input.
Repeating a previously executed lookup shows cached data immediately and only refetches according to standard query behavior (manual refetch or configured stale time).

file_operations.description: Ensure the query key includes the entered number and configure caching behavior (e.g., a reasonable staleTime) so repeated lookups reuse cached results unless explicitly refetched.
Ensure the query key includes the entered registration and configure caching behavior (e.g., a reasonable staleTime) so repeated lookups reuse cached results unless explicitly refetched.

Use React Query patterns that preserve cached results when repeating the same lookup, and keep the UI usable during refetch/loading transitions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Use React Query patterns that preserve cached results when repeating the same lookup, and keep the UI usable during refetch/loading transitions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add and render the required generated static images from frontend/public/assets/generated as part of the hacker-themed design.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.
The UI visibly uses the generated images (e.g., subtle background/hero and a small app mark) without routing image serving through the backend.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static image asset for the dark terminal-style background: frontend/public/assets/generated/hacker-bg.dim_1920x1080.png.
Add the generated static image asset for the app mark icon: frontend/public/assets/generated/hacker-mark.dim_256x256.png.
Wire frontend/public/assets/generated/hacker-bg.dim_1920x1080.png into the global UI presentation (e.g., as the page background) while keeping text readable and high-contrast.

Render the app mark image frontend/public/assets/generated/hacker-mark.dim_256x256.png in the UI (e.g., header/brand area) as part of the hacker-themed design. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
